title: React Accordion Component
description: Collapsible FAQ accordion with smooth animations
code:
import {
  Accordion,
  AccordionContent,
  AccordionItem,
  AccordionTrigger,
} from '@/components/ui/accordion'
import { Card, CardContent, CardHeader, CardTitle } from '@/components/ui/card'

function FAQAccordion() {
  return (
    <Card className="w-full max-w-2xl">
      <CardHeader>
        <CardTitle>Frequently Asked Questions</CardTitle>
      </CardHeader>
      <CardContent>
        <Accordion type="single" collapsible className="w-full">
          <AccordionItem value="item-1">
            <AccordionTrigger>What is React?</AccordionTrigger>
            <AccordionContent>
              React is a JavaScript library for building user interfaces,
              particularly single-page applications. It allows developers to
              create reusable UI components and manage the state of their
              applications efficiently.
            </AccordionContent>
          </AccordionItem>
          <AccordionItem value="item-2">
            <AccordionTrigger>How do I get started?</AccordionTrigger>
            <AccordionContent>
              Getting started is easy! You can begin by installing Node.js,
              then use Create React App or Vite to scaffold a new project.
              Follow the official React documentation for step-by-step
              tutorials and guides.
            </AccordionContent>
          </AccordionItem>
          <AccordionItem value="item-3">
            <AccordionTrigger>Is it accessible?</AccordionTrigger>
            <AccordionContent>
              Yes, when built correctly, React applications can be fully
              accessible. It's important to use semantic HTML, ARIA attributes,
              and test your application with screen readers and keyboard
              navigation.
            </AccordionContent>
          </AccordionItem>
          <AccordionItem value="item-4">
            <AccordionTrigger>Can I use it with TypeScript?</AccordionTrigger>
            <AccordionContent>
              Absolutely! React has excellent TypeScript support. TypeScript
              adds static typing to JavaScript, which helps catch errors early
              and improves code quality. Many modern React projects use
              TypeScript as the default.
            </AccordionContent>
          </AccordionItem>
        </Accordion>
      </CardContent>
    </Card>
  )
}

export default FAQAccordion

title: Project Euler #1: Multiples of 3 or 5
description: Find the sum of all multiples of 3 or 5 below 1000

title: Project Euler #2: Even Fibonacci Numbers
description: Find the sum of even-valued Fibonacci numbers not exceeding 4 million
code:
# Project Euler Problem 2
# Find the sum of even-valued Fibonacci numbers not exceeding 4 million

def solve_euler_2(limit=4_000_000):
    a, b = 1, 2
    total = 0
    
    while a <= limit:
        if a % 2 == 0:
            total += a
        a, b = b, a + b
    
    return total

result = solve_euler_2(4_000_000)
print(f"The sum of even Fibonacci numbers not exceeding 4 million is: {result}")

# Show the first few even Fibonacci numbers
print("\nFirst 10 even Fibonacci numbers:")
a, b = 1, 2
count = 0
while count < 10:
    if a % 2 == 0:
        print(f"  {count + 1}. {a}")
        count += 1
    a, b = b, a + b

title: Project Euler #6: Sum Square Difference
description: Find the difference between sum of squares and square of sum
code:
# Project Euler Problem 6
# Find the difference between the sum of the squares of the first 100 natural numbers
# and the square of the sum

def solve_euler_6(n=100):
    # Sum of squares: 1^2 + 2^2 + ... + n^2
    sum_of_squares = sum(i**2 for i in range(1, n + 1))
    
    # Square of sum: (1 + 2 + ... + n)^2
    square_of_sum = sum(range(1, n + 1)) ** 2
    
    difference = square_of_sum - sum_of_squares
    
    return sum_of_squares, square_of_sum, difference

sum_sq, sq_sum, diff = solve_euler_6(100)
print(f"Sum of squares (1Â² + 2Â² + ... + 100Â²) = {sum_sq}")
print(f"Square of sum (1 + 2 + ... + 100)Â² = {sq_sum}")
print(f"Difference = {diff}")

# Using mathematical formulas for efficiency
def solve_euler_6_optimized(n=100):
    # Formula: sum of squares = n(n+1)(2n+1)/6
    sum_of_squares = n * (n + 1) * (2 * n + 1) // 6
    
    # Formula: sum = n(n+1)/2, so square of sum = [n(n+1)/2]^2
    square_of_sum = (n * (n + 1) // 2) ** 2
    
    return square_of_sum - sum_of_squares

print(f"\nOptimized solution: {solve_euler_6_optimized(100)}")

title: Fibonacci Sequence Generator
description: Generate Fibonacci numbers using different approaches
code:
# Generate Fibonacci sequence using different methods

# Method 1: Iterative
def fibonacci_iterative(n):
    if n <= 0:
        return []
    elif n == 1:
        return [0]
    
    fib = [0, 1]
    for i in range(2, n):
        fib.append(fib[i-1] + fib[i-2])
    return fib

print("First 15 Fibonacci numbers (iterative):")
print(fibonacci_iterative(15))

# Method 2: Generator (memory efficient)
def fibonacci_generator(n):
    a, b = 0, 1
    count = 0
    while count < n:
        yield a
        a, b = b, a + b
        count += 1

print("\nFirst 15 Fibonacci numbers (generator):")
print(list(fibonacci_generator(15)))

# Method 3: Recursive (with memoization)
def fibonacci_recursive(n, memo={}):
    if n in memo:
        return memo[n]
    if n <= 1:
        return n
    memo[n] = fibonacci_recursive(n-1, memo) + fibonacci_recursive(n-2, memo)
    return memo[n]

print("\n20th Fibonacci number (recursive with memoization):")
print(fibonacci_recursive(20))

title: Prime Number Generator
description: Find prime numbers using the Sieve of Eratosthenes
code:
# Prime number algorithms

# Method 1: Simple prime checker
def is_prime(n):
    if n < 2:
        return False
    if n == 2:
        return True
    if n % 2 == 0:
        return False
    
    # Check odd divisors up to sqrt(n)
    i = 3
    while i * i <= n:
        if n % i == 0:
            return False
        i += 2
    return True

print("Prime numbers up to 50:")
primes = [n for n in range(2, 51) if is_prime(n)]
print(primes)

# Method 2: Sieve of Eratosthenes (efficient for finding many primes)
def sieve_of_eratosthenes(limit):
    if limit < 2:
        return []
    
    # Create a boolean array and initialize all as true
    is_prime = [True] * (limit + 1)
    is_prime[0] = is_prime[1] = False
    
    p = 2
    while p * p <= limit:
        if is_prime[p]:
            # Mark all multiples of p as not prime
            for i in range(p * p, limit + 1, p):
                is_prime[i] = False
        p += 1
    
    return [i for i in range(limit + 1) if is_prime[i]]

print("\nFirst 25 primes using Sieve:")
all_primes = sieve_of_eratosthenes(100)
print(all_primes[:25])
print(f"\nTotal primes up to 100: {len(all_primes)}")

title: Python Data Structures Demo
description: Working with lists, dictionaries, sets, and tuples
code:
# Python data structures examples

# Lists (mutable, ordered)
fruits = ['apple', 'banana', 'cherry', 'date']
print("Lists:")
print(f"  Original: {fruits}")
fruits.append('elderberry')
print(f"  After append: {fruits}")
print(f"  Second item: {fruits[1]}")

# Dictionaries (key-value pairs)
person = {
    'name': 'Alice',
    'age': 30,
    'city': 'New York',
    'hobbies': ['reading', 'coding', 'hiking']
}
print("\nDictionaries:")
print(f"  Person: {person}")
print(f"  Name: {person['name']}")
print(f"  Hobbies: {', '.join(person['hobbies'])}")

# Sets (unique, unordered)
numbers = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 3, 2, 1}
print("\nSets (duplicates removed):")
print(f"  Numbers: {numbers}")
more_numbers = {4, 5, 6, 7, 8}
print(f"  Union: {numbers | more_numbers}")
print(f"  Intersection: {numbers & more_numbers}")

# Tuples (immutable, ordered)
coordinates = (10, 20)
print("\nTuples:")
print(f"  Coordinates: {coordinates}")
x, y = coordinates
print(f"  x={x}, y={y}")

# List comprehensions
squares = [x**2 for x in range(1, 11)]
print(f"\nList comprehension (squares): {squares}")
evens = [x for x in range(1, 21) if x % 2 == 0]
print(f"Even numbers 1-20: {evens}")

title: Python File Operations
description: Reading and writing files with error handling
code:
# Python file operations (simulated for web environment)

# Note: In a real environment, these would work with actual files
# Here we demonstrate the patterns

print("File Operations Patterns:\n")

# Writing to a file
print("1. Writing to a file:")
file_content = """# Example of writing to a file
try:
    with open('example.txt', 'w') as f:
        f.write('Hello, World!\\n')
        f.write('This is a second line.\\n')
    print('  âœ“ File written successfully')
except IOError as e:
    print(f'  âœ— Error writing file: {e}')
"""
print(file_content)

# Reading from a file
print("\n2. Reading from a file:")
read_example = """try:
    with open('example.txt', 'r') as f:
        content = f.read()
        print(content)
except FileNotFoundError:
    print('  âœ— File not found')
except IOError as e:
    print(f'  âœ— Error reading file: {e}')
"""
print(read_example)

# Reading lines
print("\n3. Reading line by line:")
lines_example = """with open('example.txt', 'r') as f:
    for line_num, line in enumerate(f, 1):
        print(f'  Line {line_num}: {line.strip()}')
"""
print(lines_example)

# Demonstrate string operations as alternative
print("\n4. Working with text data:")
text_data = "Hello, World!\nThis is a second line.\nAnd a third!"
lines = text_data.split('\n')
print(f"  Total lines: {len(lines)}")
for i, line in enumerate(lines, 1):
    print(f"  Line {i}: {line}")

title: Interactive: Simple Calculator

code:
# Interactive calculator

print("=== Simple Calculator ===")
print()

num1 = float(input("Enter first number: "))
num2 = float(input("Enter second number: "))

print("\nAvailable operations:")
print("  + : Addition")
print("  - : Subtraction")
print("  * : Multiplication")
print("  / : Division")
print()

operation = input("Choose operation (+, -, *, /): ")

if operation == '+':
    result = num1 + num2
    print(f"\n{num1} + {num2} = {result}")
elif operation == '-':
    result = num1 - num2
    print(f"\n{num1} - {num2} = {result}")
elif operation == '*':
    result = num1 * num2
    print(f"\n{num1} Ã— {num2} = {result}")
elif operation == '/':
    if num2 != 0:
        result = num1 / num2
        print(f"\n{num1} Ã· {num2} = {result}")
    else:
        print("\nError: Cannot divide by zero!")
else:
    print("\nInvalid operation!")

title: Interactive: Number Guessing Game
description: Classic number guessing game with user input
code:
# Number guessing game
import random

print("=== Number Guessing Game ===")
print("I'm thinking of a number between 1 and 100...")
print()

target = random.randint(1, 100)
attempts = 0
max_attempts = 7

while attempts < max_attempts:
    guess = int(input(f"Attempt {attempts + 1}/{max_attempts} - Enter your guess: "))
    attempts += 1
    
    if guess < target:
        print("Too low! Try a higher number.\n")
    elif guess > target:
        print("Too high! Try a lower number.\n")
    else:
        print(f"\nðŸŽ‰ Congratulations! You guessed it in {attempts} attempts!")
        break
else:
    print(f"\nðŸ˜ž Game over! The number was {target}.")
    print(f"You used all {max_attempts} attempts.")

noun2 = input("Enter another noun: ")
adjective2 = input("Enter another adjective: ")
noun3 = input("Enter a plural noun: ")
verb2 = input("Enter a verb: ")
noun4 = input("Enter one more noun: ")

print("\n" + "=" * 50)
print("YOUR STORY:")
print("=" * 50)
print()
print(f"Once upon a time, there was a {adjective1} {noun1}.")
print(f"It loved {verb1} in the park every morning.")
print(f"One day, it found a mysterious {noun2} on the ground.")
print(f"The {noun2} was so {adjective2} that it started to glow!")
print(f"Suddenly, hundreds of tiny {noun3} appeared and began to {verb2}.")
print(f"The {noun1} was amazed and took the {noun2} to the nearest {noun4}.")
print(f"And they all lived happily ever after!")
print()
print("=" * 50)
print("The End!")

# Calculate totals

# Display budget summary

print()
print("EXPENSES:")
print(f"  Housing:             ${housing_total:>12,.2f}")
print(f"  Transportation:      ${transport_total:>12,.2f}")
print(f"  Food:                ${food_total:>12,.2f}")
print(f"  Other:               ${other_total:>12,.2f}")
print(f"  Savings:             ${savings_goal:>12,.2f}")
print("-" * 50)
print(f"Total Expenses:        ${total_expenses:>12,.2f}")
print()
print("-" * 50)

if remaining >= 0:
    print(f"Remaining Balance:     ${remaining:>12,.2f} âœ“")
    print("\nâœ… Great! You're within budget!")
    if remaining > 0:
        print(f"   Consider adding ${remaining:,.2f} to savings!")
else:
    print(f"Over Budget:           ${abs(remaining):>12,.2f} âš ï¸")
    print("\nâš ï¸  Warning: You're spending more than you earn!")
    print("   Consider reducing expenses or increasing income.")

print("=" * 50)

# Calculate percentages
print("\nBUDGET BREAKDOWN (% of income):")
print(f"  Housing:        {(housing_total/total_income)*100:>5.1f}%")
print(f"  Transportation: {(transport_total/total_income)*100:>5.1f}%")
print(f"  Food:           {(food_total/total_income)*100:>5.1f}%")
print(f"  Other:          {(other_total/total_income)*100:>5.1f}%")
print(f"  Savings:        {(savings_goal/total_income)*100:>5.1f}%")
print()
print("ðŸ’¡ Recommended: 50% needs, 30% wants, 20% savings")

title: Interactive: Text Adventure Game

# Interactive Text Adventure Game
import random

print("=" * 60)

# Introduction

# Starting point
print("-" * 60)
print("You find yourself at a fork in the path.")
print("To the LEFT, you hear the sound of running water.")
print("To the RIGHT, you see smoke rising in the distance.")
print("STRAIGHT ahead, the path continues deeper into the forest.")
print("-" * 60)

choice1 = input("\nWhich way do you go? (left/right/straight): ").lower()

if choice1 == "left":
    print("\nðŸŒŠ You follow the sound of water and discover a river!")
    print("A friendly otter surfaces and offers you a shiny stone.")
    print("\"This stone grants one wish,\" the otter squeaks.")
    print()
    
    wish = input("What do you wish for? (treasure/wisdom/power): ").lower()
    
    if wish == "treasure":
        gold = random.randint(100, 1000)
        print(f"\nâœ¨ A chest appears with {gold} gold coins!")
        print(f"Congratulations {name}, you're rich!")
        ending = "WEALTHY"
    elif wish == "wisdom":
        print("\nðŸ“š Ancient knowledge floods your mind!")
        print("You now understand the secrets of the forest.")
        print("You become the forest's guardian.")
        ending = "WISE"
    else:
        print("\nâš¡ Lightning surges through you!")
        print("You gain the power to control nature.")
        print("But with great power comes great responsibility...")
        ending = "POWERFUL"

elif choice1 == "right":
    print("\nðŸ”¥ You approach the smoke and find a small village!")
    print("The villagers are celebrating a harvest festival.")
    print()
    
    participate = input("Do you join the celebration? (yes/no): ").lower()
    
    if participate == "yes":
        print("\nðŸŽ‰ The villagers welcome you warmly!")
        print("You feast, dance, and make many friends.")
        
        activity = input("\nWhat do you do? (dance/eat/compete): ").lower()
        
        if activity == "dance":
            print("\nðŸ’ƒ Your dancing impresses everyone!")
            print("The village chief offers you a home here.")
            print(f"{name} finds a new family in the village.")
            ending = "JOYFUL"
        elif activity == "eat":
            print("\nðŸ– You try every delicious dish!")
            print("The food gives you incredible strength.")
            print("You become the village's strongest protector.")
            ending = "STRONG"
        else:
            print("\nðŸ† You enter the competition and WIN!")
            print("You're crowned the festival champion!")
            print("Your name becomes legend in the village.")
            ending = "LEGENDARY"
    else:
        print("\nðŸ˜” You decide to continue your journey alone.")
        print("As you leave, you wonder what could have been...")
        ending = "WANDERER"

else:
    print("\nðŸŒ² You venture deeper into the mysterious forest.")
    print("The trees grow thicker and the path darker.")
    print("Suddenly, you encounter a talking owl!")
    print()
    print("The owl says: \"I can guide you out, but first...\"")
    print("\"Answer my riddle correctly!\"")
    print()
    
    print("RIDDLE: I speak without a mouth and hear without ears.")
    print("        I have no body, but come alive with wind.")
    print("        What am I?")
    print()
    
    riddle = input("Your answer: ").lower()
    
    if "echo" in riddle:
        print("\nðŸ¦‰ \"CORRECT!\" hoots the owl excitedly.")
        print("The owl transforms into a magical spirit!")
        print("It grants you the ability to speak with all animals.")
        print(f"{name} becomes a legendary beast master!")
        ending = "ENLIGHTENED"
    else:
        print("\nðŸ¦‰ \"Incorrect,\" says the owl. \"The answer was ECHO.\"")
        print("\"But I admire your courage to try!\"")
        print("The owl guides you out anyway and gives you a magic feather.")
        print("The feather will always point you home.")
        ending = "FORTUNATE"

# Conclusion
print("\n" + "=" * 60)
print(f"         {name}'S ADVENTURE ENDS - {ending} ENDING")
print("=" * 60)
print(f"\nThank you for playing, {name}!")
print("Every choice creates a different story...")
print("Try again to discover all the endings!")
print("\n" + "=" * 60)

title: Interactive: Study Session Planner
description: Plan study sessions with breaks using the Pomodoro technique
code:
# Study Session Planner - Pomodoro Technique
import random

print("=" * 60)
print("       STUDY SESSION PLANNER - POMODORO TECHNIQUE")
print("=" * 60)
print()
print("ðŸ“š The Pomodoro Technique helps you study effectively!")
print("   â€¢ Study for 25 minutes (1 Pomodoro)")
print("   â€¢ Take a 5-minute break")
print("   â€¢ After 4 Pomodoros, take a 15-30 minute long break")
print()

# Get student information
student_name = input("What's your name? ")
subject = input("What subject are you studying today? ")
print()

# Determine study duration
print("How long do you want to study?")
print("  1. Quick session (1 hour)")
print("  2. Medium session (2 hours)")
print("  3. Long session (3 hours)")
print("  4. Marathon session (4+ hours)")
print()

duration_choice = input("Choose session length (1-4): ")

if duration_choice == "1":
    pomodoros = 2
    session_name = "Quick"
elif duration_choice == "2":
    pomodoros = 4
    session_name = "Medium"
elif duration_choice == "3":
    pomodoros = 6
    session_name = "Long"
else:
    pomodoros = 8
    session_name = "Marathon"

print()
print(f"âœ“ {session_name} session selected: {pomodoros} Pomodoros")
print()

# Set goals for each Pomodoro
goals = []
print("Set a specific goal for each Pomodoro:")
print("-" * 60)

for i in range(pomodoros):
    goal = input(f"  Pomodoro {i+1} goal: ")
    goals.append(goal)

print()

# Difficulty level
difficulty = input("Rate your energy level (high/medium/low): ").lower()

if difficulty == "high":
    tip = "Great! Tackle the hardest topics first."
    emoji = "ðŸ’ª"
elif difficulty == "medium":
    tip = "Good! Mix challenging and easier topics."
    emoji = "ðŸ‘"
else:
    tip = "No worries! Start with easier topics to build momentum."
    emoji = "ðŸŒ±"

print(f"\n{emoji} {tip}")
print()

# Study environment
music = input("Will you use background music? (yes/no): ").lower()
if music == "yes":
    music_type = input("What type? (classical/lofi/nature/silence): ")
    print(f"\nðŸŽµ {music_type.title()} music - Excellent choice!")
else:
    print("\nðŸ”‡ Silence can be golden for concentration!")

print()

# Distraction management
phone = input("Will you put your phone away? (yes/no): ").lower()
if phone == "yes":
    print("\nðŸ“± âœ“ Great! Eliminating distractions boosts focus by 40%!")
else:
    print("\nðŸ“± âš ï¸  Tip: Phone notifications reduce productivity by 40%")

print()

# Generate study plan
print("\n" + "=" * 60)
print(f"    {student_name.upper()}'S STUDY PLAN - {subject.upper()}")
print("=" * 60)
print()

total_study_time = pomodoros * 25
total_break_time = (pomodoros - 1) * 5 + (pomodoros // 4) * 15
total_time = total_study_time + total_break_time

print(f"Total study time:  {total_study_time} minutes")
print(f"Total break time:  {total_break_time} minutes")
print(f"Total session:     {total_time} minutes ({total_time//60}h {total_time%60}m)")
print()
print("SCHEDULE:")
print("-" * 60)

for i in range(pomodoros):
    print(f"\nðŸ… Pomodoro {i+1}: {goals[i]}")
    print(f"   Duration: 25 minutes")
    
    if (i + 1) % 4 == 0 and i < pomodoros - 1:
        print(f"   â˜• LONG BREAK: 15-30 minutes")
        print(f"      Suggestion: Take a walk, stretch, have a snack")
    elif i < pomodoros - 1:
        print(f"   â˜• Short break: 5 minutes")
        print(f"      Suggestion: Stand up, get water, look away from screen")

print()
print("-" * 60)

# Motivational tips
motivation = [
    "You've got this! Break down big tasks into small steps.",
    "Remember: Progress over perfection!",
    "Each Pomodoro is a small victory. Celebrate them!",
    "Your future self will thank you for studying today.",
    "Focus on understanding, not just memorizing."
]

print(f"\nðŸ’¡ {random.choice(motivation)}")

# Success tracking
print()
track = input("\nWould you like to track your completion? (yes/no): ").lower()

if track == "yes":
    print("\nðŸ“Š TRACKING YOUR SESSION")
    print("-" * 60)
    completed = 0
    
    for i in range(pomodoros):
        done = input(f"\nðŸ… Pomodoro {i+1}: {goals[i]}\n   Completed? (yes/no): ").lower()
        if done == "yes":
            completed += 1
            print(f"   âœ“ Great job! ({completed}/{pomodoros} completed)")
        else:
            print(f"   â†’ That's okay! ({completed}/{pomodoros} completed so far)")
    
    print("\n" + "=" * 60)
    print("         SESSION COMPLETE!")
    print("=" * 60)
    print(f"\nPomodoros completed: {completed}/{pomodoros}")
    
    success_rate = (completed / pomodoros) * 100
    print(f"Success rate: {success_rate:.1f}%")
    
    if success_rate == 100:
        print("\nðŸŒŸ PERFECT SESSION! You're a study champion! ðŸŒŸ")
    elif success_rate >= 75:
        print("\nðŸŽ‰ Excellent work! You're building great habits!")
    elif success_rate >= 50:
        print("\nðŸ‘ Good effort! Keep improving each session!")
    else:
        print("\nðŸ’ª Every session is practice. You'll do better next time!")
    
    # Study streak
    print()
    today_streak = input("\nHow many days in a row have you studied? ")
    print(f"\nðŸ”¥ {today_streak}-day streak! Consistency is key to mastery!")
else:
    print("\nGood luck with your study session!")
    print(f"Remember your goals and take those breaks, {student_name}!")

print("\n" + "=" * 60)
print(f"Happy studying, {student_name}! You're investing in yourself! ðŸ“šâœ¨")
print("=" * 60)
